:::{#hero}

I am a spatial ecologist interested in the processes that drive the distribution and abundance of animal populations. My work combines fieldwork, large-scale data synthesis, and quantitative modelling to tackle questions in conservation biology, biogeography, and movement ecology.

I work as **Assistant Professor** at [Universidad Complutense de Madrid](https://www.ucm.es/bee/directorio/?id=29786), where I combine research with teaching.

### Interests

- Conservation biology
- Biogeography
- Biodiversity modelling
- Citizen science
- Movement ecology

### Education

- **PhD in Ecology**, 2017 -- Universidad Complutense de Madrid
- **MSc Conservation Biology**, 2012 -- Universidad Complutense de Madrid
- **BSc Biology**, 2011 -- Universidad Complutense de Madrid

:::

---

## What I Do

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### Movement & Dispersal
Understanding how animals move across landscapes, from daily foraging to lifetime dispersal events, and what this means for population connectivity and range dynamics.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### Conservation & Global Change
Translating ecological models into conservation tools for threatened species, large carnivore management, and habitat connectivity under climate change.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
### Teaching & Mentoring
Training students in quantitative ecology, from R programming basics to advanced species distribution modelling.
:::

:::

[More about my research](research/index.qmd)

## Current Projects

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### [INTRADISP](projects/intradisp.qmd)
**Principal Investigator**
Why do individuals of the same species disperse so differently? We're using European bird ringing data to find out.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### [RIMed-Fauna](projects/remined.qmd)
**Team member**
How does wildlife adapt to the extreme seasonality of Mediterranean rivers? Camera trapping and SDMs in National Parks.
:::

:::
